intro: Cytisus proliferus var. palmensis, commonly known as the Canary Island broom, is a shrub native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring, adding a vibrant touch to its natural habitat. The plant has slender, thornless stems and bipinnate leaves that are finely divided. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region. This variant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
